Name: Chivalry-MedievalWarfare
Overview:
This Docker will download and install SteamCMD. It will also install Chivalry: Medieval Warfare and run it.

ATTENTION: First Startup can take very long since it downloads the gameserver files!

Update Notice: Simply restart the container if a newer version of the game is available.

Server Config: You find the server config in: 'appdata/UDKGame/Config/' (eg: the servername is located in: 'PCServer-UDKGame.ini')

You can also run multiple servers with only one SteamCMD directory!
DonateText: If you like my work please

@attributes.Name: GAME_ID
@attributes.Description:
The GAME_ID that the container download at startup.
(https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dedicated_Servers_List)

@attributes.Name: Game Parameters
@attributes.Description: Enter your game parameters seperated with ? and start with a ? (don't put spaces in between eg: ?port=7000?queryport=7010)

@attributes.Name: Extra Game Parameters
@attributes.Description: Type in your Extra Game Parameters seperated with a space and - (eg: -seekfreeloadingserver)

@attributes.Name: UDP1 - GamePort
@attributes.Description: UDP Gameport (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change the Ports in your 'Game Parameters' Variable)

@attributes.Name: UDP2 - GameQueryPort
@attributes.Description: UDP Gamequeryport (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change the Ports in your 'Game Parameters' Variable)

@attributes.Name: UDP3 - SteamQueryPort
@attributes.Description: UDP Steamqueryport (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change the Ports in your 'Game Parameters' Variable)

@attributes.Name: Steam-Username
@attributes.Description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

@attributes.Name: Validate Installation
@attributes.Description: Set the Variable to 'true' if you want to validate the installation otherwise leave it blank.

@attributes.Name: Steam-Password
@attributes.Description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).
